十大比特币开采国家及其可再生电力组合

比特币矿工每年估计消耗348 太瓦时的电力，随着世界越来越多地转向可再生能源，一些人会问：比特币从哪里获得电力？

为了回答这个问题，我们与HIVE Digital合作，对来自剑桥替代金融中心和面向气候的能源智库 Ember 的数据进行可视化，以研究比特币网络的电力结构。

这是我们的《比特币有多环保？》的第一部分。系列，探讨了加密货币的可持续性。

比特币眼中的世界

按算力（计算能力的衡量标准）计算，比特币挖矿排名前 10 的国家占整个网络的 93.8%，其中美国、中国和哈萨克斯坦位列前三。截至 2021 年底，这三个国家总共托管了近四分之三的网络。

中国曾经是比特币挖矿的头把交椅，占全球产能的 75% ，但 2021 年夏季的打击行动导致其份额在短短几个月内跌至零。许多矿工搬迁到附近的哈萨克斯坦，受到廉价电力、宽松监管和“稳定”政治气候的吸引，而其他矿工则选择了美国。尘埃落定后，中国也出现了规模相当大的秘密采矿现场。

排在前 10 名最后的是爱尔兰、新加坡和泰国，它们合计占网络的 4.9%。爱尔兰报告的份额（这也适用于排名第六的德国）被认为是由于其他国家的矿工掩盖其真实位置而造成的严重夸大。

可再生能源的作用

从国家层面来看，美国、中国和哈萨克斯坦的可再生能源份额分别为 22.5%、30.2% 和 11.3%。就背景而言，到 2022 年，可再生能源将占全球发电量的 30% （不包括核电）。

哈萨克斯坦的可再生能源份额惨淡是由于其严重依赖煤炭（60%），而煤炭也是这个中亚国家的主要出口产品。与此同时，煤炭在中国的发电量与之相当（61%），但由于风能和太阳能的快速扩张，其总体可再生能源份额更高。

货车何？

比特币矿工安装钻机的地点很重要，因为与许多其他拥有工厂或大型总部的行业不同，它们是移动的（如果你需要说服力的话，谷歌“ 比特币采矿运输集装箱”）。

他们选择在哪里铺设木瓦是基于监管制度、电价等因素，而且由于比特币设备会产生大量热量，因此需要考虑室外平均温度。关于最后一点，以下是按年平均气温划分的前 10 名的情况：

然而，随着气候变化推动可再生能源的发展，许多比特币矿工越来越密切地关注他们的电力来自哪里。这可能就是为什么加拿大——尽管水力发电资源丰富——在网络中的排名从 2019 年的不到 1% 攀升至 2021 年底的 6% 半。

但考虑到冰岛、巴拉圭和挪威等顶级可再生能源国家总共仅占全球网络的百分之一以上，因此仍有很大的增长空间。

地图解说：加沙地带

哈马斯最近对以色列的袭击使加沙地带牢牢地成为全球新闻周期的焦点。

虽然头条新闻和新闻报道彻底报道了世界该地区的冲突，但有关加沙的更基本事实却很少受到关注。通过此信息图，我们的目标是填补其中一些空白，包括人口统计、基础设施等。

下面，我们概述了有关加沙地带和居住在那里的人们的三个关键事实：

1. 加沙年轻且日益拥挤

加沙的生育率很高（3.9），因此，居住在那里的人口中有近一半是儿童。这些快速增长的人口中的大部分生活在拥挤的城市和营地中，这些都是世界上人口最稠密的地区之一。

加沙地带的大多数人被联合国正式视为难民。几十年来，难民营已成为永久定居点，与周围的城市地区融为一体。超过 80% 的人口依靠国际援助来获得基本服务和生计。

在宗教方面，加沙非常统一。 99%的人口是逊尼派穆斯林。这与埃及和其他北非国家类似。

2. 领土受到严格控制

自2007年哈马斯控制加沙地带以来，以色列一直实施陆地、空中和海上封锁，以色列安全内阁将该地区标记为“敌对实体”。加沙地带的陆地边界戒备森严，由双丝围栏和混凝土屏障组成。这些边界遵循阿以战争结束后划定的“绿线”。领土边界内还设有100至300米的缓冲区，限制出入。

有两个过境点——一个在南部进入埃及，一个在北部进入以色列——只有有限数量的平民可以通过。多年来，领土东部的过境点已被关闭。领土底角还有一个大型过境点，作为从埃及进入的货物的检查站。

该地区的领空由以色列控制。甚至其电磁空间也受到限制，这意味着许多巴勒斯坦人依赖2G和3G。

3. 基础设施不完善

多年的冲突和投资不足导致加沙地带大部分地区的基础设施陷入混乱。

例如，只有一个柴油发电厂为整个地区提供服务。电线从邻国以色列延伸至加沙，但即使在非冲突时期，该地区也存在严重的电力短缺。

加沙通过沿海含水层（由于过度开采而不断减少的地下水供应）和海水淡化厂获取淡水。国际援助努力正在改善局势，但基础设施仍然因疏忽和间歇性空袭而遭到破坏。

由于外国援助，水处理基础设施正在慢慢改善，进入地中海的原污水也减少了。这项清理工作帮助该地区的海滩创造了更多的休闲机会。

投资组合中有哪些气候风险？

地球变暖给社会带来了明显的风险。为此，自然灾害、政策变化和技术变革都有可能影响投资者的投资组合。但到什么程度呢？

我们与MSCI合作，探讨气候风险对投资的影响，以及如何在区域基础上对其进行评估。

如何评估气候风险

气候风险价值 (VaR) 是衡量气候变化可能产生的潜在额外成本的指标，以公司估值的百分比表示，因此投资者可以更好地做好应对风暴的准备。它评估气候风险的两个维度：

1. 转型气候风险价值

这衡量了向低碳经济转型的潜在财务损失。它有以下几类：

  • 政策风险：由于影响公司的潜在政策和监管变化而产生，包括处罚、声誉损害或投资者信心丧失。
  • 技术机会：由于转向新的、更好的环保技术而出现，例如太阳能、电动汽车和智能电网。

2.自然气候VaR

该指标衡量了由于气候变化的物理影响（例如热浪、海啸和农作物歉收）造成的潜在经济损失。

例如，包括澳大利亚和新西兰在内的太平洋地区拥有许多低洼岛屿，因此非常容易受到气候变化的影响。

由于从气候政策到气候条件等一系列因素，包括野火或洪水的可能性增加，气候风险可能因地区而异。

在另一个国家投资有什么风险？

鉴于新兴经济体的快速增长以及这可能给投资者带来的机遇，这就提出了一个问题：海外投资是否会带来风险？如何分析这种风险？

为了帮助回答这个问题，这张图表根据纽约大学斯特恩商学院阿斯瓦斯·达莫达兰的分析显示了世界各地的国家风险。

方法论

由于多种原因，不同国家的风险存在差异。这些都可能受到地缘政治因素的影响，例如政治风险，是否处于早期增长阶段，或是否拥有稳定的产权。

为了更清楚地了解国家风险，达莫达兰分析了以下主要因素：

  • 政治风险：政权类型、腐败、冲突程度
  • 法律风险：产权保护、合同权
  • 经济风险：经济多元化

此外，还分析了一个国家的违约风险，这是金融市场中常用的衡量标准。当一个国家拖欠债务时，通常会导致市场动荡以及其他可能持续多年的负面影响。

这些因素与其他因素一起估算国家风险溢价，即给定市场的额外风险。美国是衡量各国额外风险的基准。

The US 30-year fixed-rate mortgage has reached its highest level since 2002.

Coupled with rising home prices and a constrained housing inventory, US housing affordability is now at its lowest point in history, according to the National Association of Realtors .

In the graphic above, we take a closer look at how the US 30-year fixed-rate mortgage has evolved since 2013 against the backdrop of existing home sales, using data from both Freddie Mac and Trading Economics .

A Decade in Review: US 30-Year Fixed-Rate Mortgages

Due to the stability and predictability they offer, fixed-rate mortgages remain very popular among American homebuyers. In 2021, 30-year fixed-rate mortgages made up 70% of all issued mortgages in the country.

Naturally, this surge may leave many people wondering about the reasons behind this drastic change and whether they will drop any time soon.

Why Do Mortgage Rates Rise?

Mortgage rates rise in response to various economic indicators and policy changes.

Over the years, factors such as shifts in the Federal Reserve's monetary policy, inflation concerns , the state of the bond market, and fluctuations in economic growth have all played roles in influencing mortgage rates.

2023 is no different, with many different economic and global events at play. It's also notable that these high mortgage rates are affecting home sales in the US, specifically with existing home sales taking a dip while new home sales subtly rise.

This change in dynamics is occurring as homeowners with low mortgage rates hesitate to sell their homes and get back in the market amidst high mortgage rates. In turn, demand from buyers is increasing new home sales and pushing prices even higher.

What's In Store for US Mortgage Rates?

US mortgage rates remain above 7% for the time being. However, experts suggest that rates may have already peaked and will likely start to fall in the coming months as recession fears subside and the economy regains its momentum.

The Mortgage Bankers Association estimates that the US 30-year fixed-rate mortgage will fall to 6.3% by the end of 2023 and 5.4% by the end of 2024. Based on these predictions, it's likely that the rates that characterized 2020 and 2021 will not be returning for some time to come, despite their downward trend.

Comparing Air Quality and Pollution in 50 Capital Cities

We know bad air quality when we breathe it in—but how does it measure and compare across different cities?

To assess air quality, agencies measure the amount of particulate matter in an area to arrive at a number the resident population is breathing in over a period of time.

Airborne particulate matter (PM) is a complex mix of solids and aerosols and is defined by diameter for regulatory purposes. Particles with a diameter of 10 microns or less (PM10) are inhalable and can induce adverse health effects.

In this case, Planet Anomaly visualized the concentration of PM2.5 (fine particulate matter) in 50 select capital cities across the globe, using data from IQAir's 2022 World Air Quality Report .

The report applied population-based adjustments to standardize its results and calculated an annual average of the data. If a city exceeded the WHO safety guideline of 5 micrograms per cubic meter (μg/m³) for annual average PM2.5 levels, it implied potential health risks for its residents.

Ranked: Capital Cities With the Best and Worst Air Quality

At the top of the list with the best air quality, Canberra , the capital of Australia, had an average PM2.5 level of 2.8 μg/m³ in 2022. Vehicle emissions and dust storms are the few sources of air pollutants in the city.

In 1961, President John F. Kennedy set a national goal to have a crewed lunar landing and return to Earth.

After several failed attempts from both sides, on July 20, 1969, the Apollo 11 mission was successful and astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin became the first humans to set foot on the moon.

After the Apollo missions, the fervor of lunar exploration waned. From 1976 to 2013, no moon landing attempts occurred due to budget constraints, shifting priorities, and advances in robotic missions.

However, a new chapter in space exploration has unfolded in recent years, with emerging players entering the cosmic arena. With its Chang'e missions , China has made significant strides, landing rovers on the moon and exploring the far side of the moon.

India, too, has asserted its presence with the Chandrayaan missions . In 2023, the country became the 4th nation to reach the moon as an unmanned spacecraft landed near the lunar south pole, advancing the country's space ambitions to learn more about the lunar ice, potentially one of the moon's most valuable resources.

Exploring Lunar Water

Since the 1960s, even before the historic Apollo landing, scientists had theorized the potential existence of water on the moon.

In 2008, Brown University researchers employed advanced technology to reexamine lunar samples, discovering hydrogen within beads of volcanic glass . And in 2009, a NASA instrument aboard the India's Chandrayaan-1 probe confirmed the presence of water on the moon's surface.

Water is deemed crucial for future space exploration. Beyond serving as a potential source of drinking water for future moon explorations, ice deposits could play a pivotal role in cooling equipment. Lunar ice could also be broken down to produce hydrogen for fuel and oxygen for breathing, essential for supporting extended space missions.

With a reinvigorated interest in exploring the moon, manned moon landings are on the horizon once again. In April 2023, NASA conducted tests for the launch of Artemis I, the first American spacecraft to aim for the moon since 1972.
